xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools" tools:ignore="MissingTranslation" Swiftly switch Recent App Switcher App running Step 1: 
Usage stat Step 2: 
Accessibility Step 1: Activate USAGE STAT permission.
In order for Swiftly switch to get your recent app, you need to turn on the USAGE STAT permission for this app. Step 2: Activate ACCESSIBILITY service.
To use the navigation function(HOME, BACK) you need to turn on the Accessibility service for this app. Go to setting Set the edge Edge 1 Edge 2 Edge 1
(activate) Edge 2
(not activate) Edge 2
(activate) Step 1: Active USAGE STAT permission 
If your software version is kitkat or below, you done need to care about this setting You have completed this setting You have completed this setting Position Sensitive Length Right top Right centre Right bottom Left top Left centre Left bottom Bottom left Bottom centre Bottom right Offset Default Cancel Ok Favorite shortcut: Favorite shortcut Apps/shortcut that will be listed when you hold on the one of the recent apps icon for 1 second or when there are no recent app The limit for favorite app is 6! Black list Black list: Apps that will not be listed in the recent apps Please add your favorite apps in the FAVORITE APP section Wait a second, app loading ... Hide this by tapping then selecting Block notification from the info page Swiftly switch is running ... You need to complete 2 STEP setting below before you can use this app! Configuration The Edge 2 is only available in Pro version This feature only available for the Pro version Get Pro version Upgrade to Pro You are out of 7 day trial time of this application. Upgrade to Pro version to use this feature Setting Please turn on this setting.This is for navigation(home,back,power menu) and on some Samsung device for expand status bar. Enable accessibility can cause lag in some device when using Chrome. This happen to all apps that use accessibility. If the lag is too extreme please disable this setting, all feature still available except the navigation (home, back, power menu). Please turn on the Accessibility setting for this app Haptic feedback on trigger Haptic feedback on move to icon Do you love this app? Yes No Please consider vote for this app on Store Circle size Favorite shortcut setting ChooseShortcutActivity Hello World from section: %1$d Back Next OK On/off wifi On/off bluetooth Auto/lock rotation Show power menu None Back Home Expand status bar Click here and grant WRITE SETTING for Swiftly switch Swiftly switch need Write Setting permission Apps Actions Grid size: 2 row 3 row 4 row 5 row 6 row 7 row 2 column 3 column 4 column 5 column 6 column 7 column Action 1 Action 2 Action 3 Action 4 by Space between shortcuts Distance from the Edge Mode Default Only favorite More setting Set icon pack System Outer zone Setting Outer ring action Disable accessibility Enable accessibility can cause lag in some device when using Chrome. This happen to all apps that use accessibility. If the lag is too extreme please disable the Swiftly switch accessibility service, all feature still available except the navigation (home, back, power menu). Consider disable Accessibility service Can not found this setting on your device. Please try grant it manually.
